pull.title: test: assumeutxo file with unknown block hash
pull.body: Takes care of one of the open Todos in the assumeutxo functional test. Since an unknown block could be any hash, I simply chose one placeholder, it could also be a random string though.

events.message: test: assumeutxo file with unknown block hash

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -80,6 +79,14 @@ def test_invalid_snapshot_scenarios(self, valid_snapshot_path):
         error_details = f"assumeutxo block hash in snapshot metadata not recognized ({bad_snapshot_block_hash})"
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-32603, f"Unable to load UTXO snapshot, {error_details}", self.nodes[1].loadtxoutset, bad_snapshot_path)
 
+        self.log.info("  - snapshot file refering to a block that is unknown")
+        # Represents any unknown block hash
+        bogus_block_hash = "0" * 64
comments.body: nit: Could use a for-loop, as this code is copied from above and testing the exactly same thing?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -80,6 +79,14 @@ def test_invalid_snapshot_scenarios(self, valid_snapshot_path):
         error_details = f"assumeutxo block hash in snapshot metadata not recognized ({bad_snapshot_block_hash})"
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-32603, f"Unable to load UTXO snapshot, {error_details}", self.nodes[1].loadtxoutset, bad_snapshot_path)
 
+        self.log.info("  - snapshot file refering to a block that is unknown")
+        # Represents any unknown block hash
+        bogus_block_hash = "0" * 64
comments.body: mostly, I guess having a different log output isn't that essential though, so using a loop now

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -73,12 +72,14 @@ def test_invalid_snapshot_scenarios(self, valid_snapshot_path):
         bad_snapshot_path = valid_snapshot_path + '.mod'
 
         self.log.info("  - snapshot file refering to a block that is not in the assumeutxo parameters")
-        bad_snapshot_block_hash = self.nodes[0].getblockhash(SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT - 1)
-        with open(bad_snapshot_path, 'wb') as f:
-            # block hash of the snapshot base is stored right at the start (first 32 bytes)
-            f.write(bytes.fromhex(bad_snapshot_block_hash)[::-1] + valid_snapshot_contents[32:])
-        error_details = f"assumeutxo block hash in snapshot metadata not recognized ({bad_snapshot_block_hash})"
-        assert_raises_rpc_error(-32603, f"Unable to load UTXO snapshot, {error_details}", self.nodes[1].loadtxoutset, bad_snapshot_path)
+        prev_block_hash = self.nodes[0].getblockhash(SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT - 1)
+        bogus_block_hash = "0" * 64  # Represents any unknown block hash
comments.body:
This is good.
nit:
```suggestion
        bogus_block_hash = "0" * 64  # Represents any invalid/ not recognized block hash
```
